events.name: GDG-POS Firebase Study Jam
events.description:
Firebase is Googleâ€™s mobile app development platform for iOS, Android, and mobile web developers.
Firebase gives you functionality like analytics, databases, messaging and crash reporting so you can move quickly and focus on your users.

Firebase Study Jams for Web are a great opportunity to bring members of our community together to learn how to develop web apps using some of Firebase's newly launched features for web development.

Study Jams are also study groups organized by Google Developer Groups (GDG) worldwide. In these study groups, the attendees get personal tutoring by coaches. This Study Jam is on the firebase platform for web applications.

DATE & TIME
Saturday 25th April, 2020

VENUE
This is now a digital event! We warmly welcome Trini-born Googler Arthur Thompson from the firebase team who is giving a session on firestore and functions.

RSVP for streaming links.

LEARNING CLASS:
Beginner
New To Javascript? Here an introductory code lab: https://gdgpos.com/labs/js-intro/#0

AGENDA:

10:00 : 10:10 - Intro
10:10 - 10:40 - Hosting & Perf Monitoring
10:45 - 11:15 - Extensions
Break
12:15 - 12:55 - Firestore and Functions
1:00 - 1:40 - Push Notifications

Visit https://firebase.google.com/ for more info on firebase.

WHAT YOU SHOULD KNOW BEFORE THIS TRAINING EVENT:

We would like to recommend you take some time to know about Javascript before joining us for this tutorial. This is a class for Beginners, however, we want you to make the MOST out of this learning opportunity.

Please message us anytime at [masked] for any questions or concerns about this event.

RSVP for stream access

upcoming.name: PIVOT - Get Ready to Make Your Move |  WTM-TT IWD2020 Workshop
upcoming.description:
COVID-19 has forced many of us to face the new normal and question
the futures we had planned.

Women Techmakers Trinidad & Tobago invites you to a readiness and skill building workshop designed to empower women techmakers and all industry professionals with strategic knowledge and resources that support positive change and pivot decision-making in their careers.

All attendees will receive a special resource listing curated by the Women Techmakers Committee including areas like remote work, online certification, nomad hub websites, and scholarships.

AGENDA -
SUNDAY 31ST MAY, 2020
10 AM - 12 NOON

WELCOME ADDRESS- TOGETHER WE RISE
Maria O'Brien & Lashaun Ramdin - Co-Leads
Women Techmakers Trinidad and Tobago

STRATEGIC THINKING | BEFORE YOUR MOVE

LARA QUENTRALL-THOMAS MBA
Employment Industry Founder & Expert | Corporate Community Leader

Founder and Chairman of Regency Recruitment and Resources Ltd
President - TTCSI | Director - Rotary Club of Central Port of Spain
https://www.linkedin.com/in/lara-quentrall-thomas-mba-a16ba15/

STRATEGIES FOR SUCCESSFUL ONLINE LEARNING

JACQUELINE MORRIS -
Technology Industry Expert | Educator & Community Leader

Chair- Trinidad & Tobago Internet Society
Director- iGovTT | Vice Chair- Internet Society Trinidad & Tobago
https://www.linkedin.com/in/jacquelineamorris/

LIGHTNING TALKS - REAL LIFE PIVOTS

Talks from our Diversity in Tech some of the co-founders
of Women In Tech Caribbean.

SHEREZZ GRANT - Geoscientist turned fullstack web-developer
350.org , WIT Caribbean
TOPIC: Going Remote

JANIQUE-KA JOHN - Front end Engineer- MEDIAGENIX
WIT Caribbean
TOPIC: Living your dream

We will share the LIVE Link to this event soon.

To learn more about Women Techmakers here: www.womentechmakers.com

Please RSVP to this event to register and receive updates.

See you there!
